Are you a Hebrew translator eager to shape the future of AI? Large-scale language models are evolving from clever chatbots into powerful engines of linguistic intelligence. With high-quality training data, tomorrow’s AI can deliver accurate, context-aware translations, enhance cross-cultural communication, and support learners and professionals around the world. That training data begins with you—we need your expertise to help power the next generation of AI. We’re looking for Hebrew translators with a strong command of both Hebrew and English who can assess and refine AI-generated translations for grammatical accuracy, fluency, cultural nuance, and context sensitivity. You’ll challenge the model with idiomatic expressions, ambiguous phrases, formal and informal tones, and real-world scenarios—documenting model failures and providing insight to improve translation quality and consistency. On a typical day, you will evaluate and edit AI outputs, translate between Hebrew and English in both directions, annotate errors, provide cultural or contextual explanations, and suggest improvements to prompts, evaluation methods, and model behavior. A background in professional translation, linguistics, localization, or language education is ideal. Experience with technical, literary, or media translation is a strong signal of fit. Clear, reflective communication and an ability to articulate translation decisions are essential. Ready to turn your translation expertise into the foundation for tomorrow’s AI? Apply today and help train the model that will teach the world. We offer a pay range of $8 to $65 per hour, with the exact rate determined after evaluating your experience, expertise, and geographic location. Final offer amounts may vary from the pay range listed above. As a contractor, you’ll supply a secure computer and high-speed internet; company-sponsored benefits such as health insurance and PTO do not apply. Job title: Hebrew Translator – AI TrainerEmployment type: ContractWorkplace type: RemoteSeniority level: Entry to Mid-Level

Are you an experienced Homography specialist eager to shape the future of AI? Large-scale language models and computer vision systems are evolving rapidly, moving beyond basic perception into advanced mathematical modeling, spatial reasoning, and applied problem-solving. With high-quality training data, tomorrow’s AI can deliver more accurate, reliable, and innovative solutions across fields such as robotics, augmented reality, 3D reconstruction, and visual mapping. That training data begins with you—your expertise will help power the next generation of AI. We’re looking for a Homography specialist who can bring mathematical precision, domain knowledge, and practical problem-solving skills to training data. You’ll work with cutting-edge AI tools, evaluate and refine outputs, and provide feedback on homography transformations, projective geometry, multi-view consistency, and real-world applications in vision and graphics. On a typical day, you will review and annotate AI-generated content, assess responses for correctness and clarity, identify reproducible error patterns, and collaborate with our team to refine prompts, evaluation methods, and domain-specific guidelines. Tasks may include selecting and labeling static points across images, conducting manual and synthetic homographies, validating transformation accuracy, and documenting error behavior for model improvement. Foundational knowledge of homography and projective geometry is required, supported by coursework, research, or applied experience in computer vision, robotics, graphics, or related fields. A degree in mathematics, computer science, or engineering is a plus. Strong analytical ability, clear communication skills, and attention to detail are essential. Ready to channel your homography expertise into building the AI tools of tomorrow? Apply today and help train the model that will support learners, researchers, and professionals worldwide. We offer a pay range of $8 to $65 per hour, with the exact rate determined after evaluating your experience, expertise, and geographic location. Final offer amounts may vary from the pay range listed above. As a contractor you’ll supply a secure computer and stable internet connection; company-sponsored benefits such as health insurance and PTO do not apply. Job title: Computer Vision Specialist – AI TrainerEmployment type: ContractWorkplace type: RemoteSeniority level: Entry

If you have what it takes to become part of the Vistra family and would like to start a promising career with a global leader, take a look at the exciting employment opportunities that are currently available and apply online.Job SummaryThe Innovative Automation (IA) team governs the automation of manual business processes utilizing Robotics Process Automation (RPA) and AI framework and software applications (e.g., Microsoft Power Platform, Blue Prism, etc.) including developing standards, managing demand and delivery assurance. The Innovative Automation team aids the organization by automating manual tasks performed by VST Retail employees thus releasing resource capacity back to the business for other high value activities and strategic enterprise needs. Innovative Automation and works closely with business and technology stakeholders across Vistra. This position will be responsible for supporting Microsoft Power Platform-based initiatives, developing automation solutions, supporting production automations and researching new technology for integration into VST.Job DescriptionKey Accountabilities:Analyze functional and business requirements required for automationIdentify potential processes for automation and create the solution designDevelop, configure, and deploy automation solutions according to business needs and requirements.Review, repair, and modify automation solutions to ensure technical accuracy, security compliance, and reliability standards.Perform code review, bug fixing, and exception handling.This role requires substantial utilization of automation software applications (e.g., Microsoft Power Platform, Blue Prism, etc.) to deliver value through reliable automated business processes.  The primary job functions center around the following categories:Microsoft Power Platform educational supportAutomation process developmentDemand ManagementChange ManagementEducation, Experience, & Skill Requirements:•Experience working with automation application software preferred•In-depth understanding of automation capabilities, methodology, and best practices preferred•Strong analytical and problem-solving skills• Above-average communication, organizational, and process mapping skills •Ability to establish working relationships with cross-functional partners•Minimum of a High School diploma or equivalentKey Metrics:Productive hours released to business groups by automating manual processes utilizing automation software application.Exemplify standardized best practices for all automation efforts.Maintain pipeline of manual processes and automation opportunities.Percentage of processes automated by the desired target date.Number of defect/rework hours as a percent of total deployment hours.Job FamilyGeneral ServicesCompanyVistra Retail Operations CompanyLocationsIrving, TexasTexasWe are a company of people committed to:  Exceeding Customer Expectations, Great People, Teamwork, Competitive Spirit and Effective Communication.  If this describes you, then apply today!If you currently work for Vistra or its subsidiaries, please apply via the internal career site. It is the policy of the Company to comply with all employment laws and to afford equal employment opportunity to individuals in all aspects of employment, including in selection for job opportunities, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, military service, protected veteran status, or any other consideration protected by federal, state or local laws. If you are an individual with a disability and need assistance submitting an application or would like to request an accommodation, please email us at assistance@vistraenergy.com to make a request.

Performs spatial analysis and generates maps and reports to present that analysis. Gathers requirements and assists with the development of GIS applications and interactive maps. Deploys GIS solutions; trains staff. Designs, administers and maintains spatial databases. Configures geographic information systems (GIS) and software. Performs data collection, cartography and other technical functions as necessary.

Your browser does not support the video tag. HomeCareersSoftware Engineer Digital OperationsSoftware EngineerBerthoud, Colorado The future of aerospace and defense starts here. Ursa Major was founded to revolutionize how America and its allies access and apply high-performance propulsion, from hypersonics to solid rocket motors, satellite maneuvering and launch. We design and deliver propulsion and defense systems that solve the most urgent and critical national security demands. The Software Engineering team at Ursa Major has an opportunity for an early career software engineer. In this role, you will directly impact our ability to scale our rocket engine design, test, and manufacturing capabilities. Our team supports these capabilities by designing software systems that optimize the inner loops of critical processes and expose the relationships in our data. The ideal candidate will have a strong engineering foundation and experience working on full-stack networked services. You will be a great fit for our team if you have a growth mindset, are tenacious in attacking both problems and opportunities, and are a clear and open communicator. Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with a small, supportive, and cross-functional team of Software Engineers Support our propulsion test and development teams with a cutting-edge data processing, automation, and visualization framework Build high quality and reliable software while balancing agility and ability to deliver timely value to stakeholders Implement and maintain automated tests to support high-impact, fearless refactoring and ensure smooth, bug-free deployments Leverage CI/CD, GitOps, and other modern development practices to keep velocity high and toil low Participate in task planning and estimation alongside experienced mentors Create clear and concise documentation Qualifications: Engineering or Computer Science degree, or equivalent experience as a Software Engineer Proficiency with Python Proficiency with a statically typed and compiled language (such as C++ or Rust) Experience with writing queries for SQL databases Experience with Linux and shell scripting Comfortable with a container-based development workflow Excellent problem solving, project management, and communication skills Desired Experience: Master’s degree in engineering or computer science Experience developing software in aerospace or other highly technical field Experience working with time-series data Colorado law requires us to tell you the base compensation range of this role, which is $85,000 – $105,000, determined by your education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities. What we can’t quantify for you are the exciting challenges, supportive team, and amazing culture we enjoy. Click here for more information about our awesome benefits. Classification: Full-time Exempt Benefits Include: (Please note, Interns are not eligible for benefits) Unlimited PTO – Vacation, Sick, Personal, and Bereavement Paid Parental and Adoptive Leave Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Tax Advantage Accounts (HSA/FSA) Employer Paid Short and Long Term Disability, Basic Life, AD&D Additional Benefit Options Including Voluntary Life and Emergency Medical Transport EAP Program Retirement Savings Plan – Traditional 401(k) and a Roth 401(k) Equity Grants in the Company How To Apply: Interested candidates are encouraged to apply by filling out the application below and clicking “Submit Application”. This position will be posted for a minimum of 3 days and will remain open until filled or adjusted based on the volume of applicants. NOTE: Research suggests that women and BIPOC individuals may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We encourage anyone who believes they have the skills and the drive necessary to succeed here to apply for this role. US CITIZENSHIP, PERMANENT RESIDENCY, REFUGEE OR ASYLUM STATUS IS REQUIRED. Eligibility to obtain and maintain a U.S. Security Clearance. We’re an equal-opportunity employer. You will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status. No outside recruiters, please. const iframe = document.getElementById("grnhse_iframe"); let heightSet = false; window.addEventListener("message", function (event) { if (!event.origin.includes("greenhouse.io")) return; let data = event.data; if (!heightSet) { if (typeof data === "number") { iframe.style.height = data + "px"; heightSet = true; // ✅ ignore future updates console.log("Final iframe height set to:", data); } else if (typeof data === "object" && data.height) { iframe.style.height = data.height + "px"; heightSet = true; console.log("Final iframe height set to:", data.height); } else if (typeof data === "string") { try { const parsed = JSON.parse(data); if (parsed.height) { iframe.style.height = parsed.height + "px"; heightSet = true; console.log("Final iframe height set to:", parsed.height); } } catch (e) {} } } });
